divs: Sighting DetailsI was sitting at a bus stop after work one evening at 7:12PM. I was taking digital photos with my new camera, an Olympus FE-310. The sky was overcast with thick grey clouds. The first photo I took was of the clouds, which shows nothing unusual. For the second photo, taken mere seconds after the first, I zoomed in a little and I noticed something was now in the sky. I thought maybe it could be either a blimp, though they do not move fast enough to just appear in the second photo; or an insect flew into frame and the black speck is just that, although in the photo, the speck feels very far away in the distant sky. I wish my camera imprinted the time and date down to the second, rather than just minute, to truly show how little time lapsed between both photos. I can, and would like to, submit both high-resolution untampered photos (3264x2448) for your review. maybe its just a blimp, maybe its more. Didn't think much at the time, except how strange it was that a 'blimp' could move so fast. Within less than a minute this shape appeared and disappeared. If I knew how to check for possibly aircraft over that location at the specific time on my own, I would look into it being a blimp. I photograph the sky all the time, and have gotten birds, planes, and blimps that I could identify easily with zoom functions. This I cannot. I have attached said photos, NOTE that the timestamp on them (in the file properties) states it as 7:12 AM, though it is actually PM, my camera was new and set 12 hours behind accidentally. Hope it may be of interest.
Summary: Blimp-like object apears and disappears within less than 1 minute
trends: There has been one other sighting in Watertown
There were no other sightings in Watertown on or around May 19th 2008
This sighting has never been favorited.
